revised_title: The Effect of Speed on Recovery in Alternating Stress Tests
tldr: The authors investigate the effect of speed on the recovery of non-elastic strain in alternating stress tests. They find that changing the speed of the tests significantly affects the range of non-elastic strain, with slower speeds leading to increased strain and faster speeds leading to decreased strain. The results suggest that the main factors affecting the alteration of non-elastic strain are variation in mobility in the steel and the speed of the cycle.
